Text.Text: [Watching the players go down gangplank, speaking as if in farewell]Well, here ye are, straight from [Bremmin]Bremen to the scenic shore of [Tar-gohs]Targos herself.  [Slight smile as he gazes out across the ruined buildings]Now that ye be seeing the skeleton of the town ye'll be defendin', ye sure ye don't want me to take ye back?

[Chuckles]Now, don't be thankin' me just yet.  If we meet again, just remember I offered t'let ye stay on th' ship, so don't be cursing [Head-ron Care-dose]Hedron Kerdos for droppin' ye off in this place.
[Pointing the houses out]Aye - ye see those wrecked homes along the shore?

[Explaining]Well, the ones the goblins didn't tear down, the people o' [Tar-gohs]Targos did - they're building a wall 'round the town, and they need all the lumber they can get.  [A little lower, almost to himself]Damn wall won't keep the wind out, much less goblins, by my tell.

[Shrugs]Well, there's not much to tell.  [Uh, but don't think it's a shithole based on the docks you see here]But the dock here isn't the town - [Tar-gohs]Targos is up on the cliff above.  Mostly decent folk, but most of them have left for [Burn Shander]Bryn Shander.
[Chuckles]Aye, well, last word is my Ma was still living here, so "mostly" decent folk, aye.  A regular harpy, that one - unless ye like cats, steer clear o' her.
[A little grimmer]And all the new mercenaries and sell-swords haven't done much to help the town's color, either.  [Realizes the player is a mercenary]No offense meant.
[A little sheepish]Eh, well, I spend most of my time on the floor of the Salty Dog when I stay th' night in [Tar-gohs]Targos, which isn't often.

["It's okay."]It's a right enough place.  There's bound to be some sell-swords there who can tell you where to go and who to talk to if ye're lookin' for a bit of gold.  [Cautioning player]Might be they'll even warn ye off this bit o' foolishness yer on.

[Giving directions]It's just off the dock - step a yard or two to yer left and ye'll be at the Dog's door.  [Just realized he's sending a lamb into a wolves' den]Just watch yer step in there; it can get a little rough.

Not right away.  We've got cargo to unload, so ye might not be seein' the last of me just yet.  [Good-naturedly]'Sides, ye still might have a change of heart once ye head up the cliff and see [Tar-gohs]Targos for yourself.
[Good-naturedly, joking]Aye, the cargo that's standing here talkin' at me right now.  Get off wit' ye!  If ye be seekin' yer fortunes, ye won't be finding it on the decks of the Wicked Wench.
[Rolls his eyes.]Well, ye've never met my Ma, so we'll leave it at that.
[Rolls his eyes]Ye've never met me Ma.  If ye did, ye'd understand.  Love her t'death, and that's what she'll do to ye if yer not careful... her tongue's sharp enough to chop wood, it is.
[Um-ber-lee - an evil goddess]Umberlee's favored daughter, me Da used to say - it's where me ship got its name.
Well, me Da did, it's a long story... [rolls his eyes] an' to hear me Ma tell it, it's not half over yet.

Words are fine, but I'll be takin' my thanks in coin.  [A little more matter-of-fact as he brings up the fact he gets a commission]Lord [Uhl-brek]Ulbrec's promised me a little gold for every sell-sword I bring to [Tar-gohs]Targos, whether they sign on or not, so that's thanks enough.
[Thinking]Well, ye'd want to be seeing the lord of this place, [Uhl-brek]Ulbrec's his name.  [Doesn't care much for royalty]Good enough fella... fer a lord.
Scale the cliffs to the main town - he's bound to be in one of the manors up there.  Snag one of the locals, they can guide ye better than I could.

[Sorry to see the players go, waves them off]Pah, ye can thank me by not following foolish orders and comin' back in one piece.  As guests go, ye've been saints aboard my ship - I've got a place for ye if ye ever be needing it.

[Turns reflective, scanning the town, notices something's wrong.]Town seems a might quiet, though, and [Mag-dar]Magdar the harbor master hasn't come to try and bleed a few coins from me for a docking fee.  [Slight warning]Watch yourself... could be trouble in the wind.

[A little confused and worried; knows something's wrong.]I was hoping ye might come back - what's the word from the docks?  Not even [Mag-dar]Magdar's come out to shake me down yet, and he usually sends some half-drunk stumblers to help unload my supplies.
["You've got to be shitting me."]Goblins?  By the northern winds - the town's been *overrun?!*
[Suddenly realizes his mother is in danger.]But my Ma - I can't leave her here!  Look, she's a hard woman and all... but can you go back and make sure she's safe?
[Dammit!]By the Gods!  She was a hard woman, but she didn't need to die at a goblin's hand.  Poor woman - [shrugs]but now she's with me Da, and she's his problem now.
This woman - was she wailing enough to wake the dead and surrounded by a wall o' cats?

Her house is to the left as ye step off the docks - right in the shadow of the southern cliffs.  [A little lower, hates her cats]If that's not enough, listen for the howling of her cats, and ye'll find her right-quick.
Blessed are ye!  Thank ye - she's a cruel woman with a northern bite to her, but I still don't wish her any harm.

[Agreeing]Aye, no argument on that point; her tongue's a whip, it is.  [Gives the players a reward]Here, take this - it's the least thanks I can give ye for lending a swordarm in her defense... especially for all her spit and fire.
[Gives the players a reward]Here, take this - it's the least thanks I can give ye for lending a swordarm in her defense... especially for all her spit and fire.
[A little concerned, been hearing rumors]What's going on along the shore?  I heard something about an attack on the docks, but no one can tell me anything for certain.
["You've got to be shitting me."]Goblins were attacking the docks?  By the northern winds - how did they get past the palisades?
[Suddenly realizes his mother could be/could have been in danger]Wait - do you know if me mother's all right?  She has a house along the docks, and could be the goblins got to her during the attack.
[Concerned for his mother]You're back - any word of me Ma?
[Pleased to see player]Aye, look who's come back aboard - sick of [Tar-gohs]Targos already, are ye?

[Well, don't think I'm a nice guy, but...]Well... now, before ye be thinking I have a foolish streak meself, Lord [Uhl-brek]Ulbrec's paying me a nice lump o' gold to keep the Wicked Wench here in port.

[Matter-of-fact, but impressed that Ulbrec cares about his people]Wants to make sure the townsfolk have a way out of [Tar-gohs]Targos if things turn ugly, and that's good enough for me.  Me Ma's here, and I don't want to be seein' her come to harm.

Farewell, then - and if ye cross paths with ol' [Mag-dar]Magdar, tell that shiftless dockmaster to send some dockhands to help with the cargo if he wants [Tar-gohs]Targos to have any lumber for their precious Palisade.
[Pleased to see player]Aye, look who's come back aboard - the great goblin slayers of [Tar-gohs]Targos.  What can I do for ye?

With all the mercenary bands holed up in [Tar-gohs]Targos, there may not be a place in town for ye to rest.  If the local inn can't put you up, just come back to the ship, and I can spare a bunk or two for ye to sleep on.

[Quiets down a little bit, suggesting something illegal]Or if ye want, ye could probably slip into one of the abandoned warehouses to catch some shut-eye.  [A little embarrassed]Gods know I have after a long night at the Salty Dog.
No, we're here to stay, Hedron.  Thanks for bringing us this far.
Skeleton of a town?
What happened to those houses on the shore?
What happened to those houses on the shore?
Can you tell me anything about Targos?
Know of any place where I can stay the night?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
Can you tell me anything about Targos?
Know of any place where I can stay the night?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
Do you know of any place I can stay the night?
Mostly decent folk?
If your mother lives in Targos, why are you staying on the ship?
None taken.  Do you know of a place I can stay the night?
We'll let it pass this time.  Are there any inns in town?
Where's the Salty Dog Tavern?
So you're off, then?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
So you're off, then?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
Cargo?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
Very well.  Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
You named your ship after your *mother?*
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
You named your ship after your mother?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Any inns in town I could stay at while I'm in Targos?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
Very well.  Thanks again, Hedron.
Where can I find Lord Ulbrec?
All right.  Thanks for your help, Hedron.
All right.  Thanks for your help, Hedron.
We'll be careful.  Farewell, Hedron.
The town's been attacked by goblins.  You'd best stay on the ship.
There's been an attack on the docks, and Targos has gained a number of bloodthirsty goblin citizens.
We don't know yet - we'll come back when we know more.
A good question.  You should probably set sail in any event - Targos is no longer safe.
I'm afraid she didn't make it, Hedron... she, uh, was killed by goblins in her home.
We already checked on her, Hedron.  Some goblins had broken into her house, but we took them out and rescued her.
We encountered an old woman being menaced by goblins - I don't know whether it was your mother or not.
Your mother?  Which house is hers?
We'll see what we can do - but we need someplace safe to rest.  Can you watch over us while we catch our second wind?
We'll go check on her, Hedron.  We'll return when she's safe.
Probably so.  Farewell, Hedron.
That's her.  Some goblin attackers had broken into her home, but we took care of them.  She's safe.
The town's in danger, but we need someplace safe to rest - can you watch over us while we catch our second wind?
We'll go check on her, then.  Farewell.
It is likely the goblin attack merely frightened her.  Any harsh words she spoke probably stemmed from fear, not anger.
It is likely the goblin attack merely frightened her.  Any harsh words she spoke probably stemmed from fear, not anger.
She's certainly got a tongue on her, no doubt.
She's certainly got a tongue on her, no doubt.
She's certainly got a tongue on her, no doubt.
She was somewhat sparse with her gratitude, Hedron.  Perhaps you could remedy that.
She was somewhat sparse with her gratitude, Hedron.  Perhaps you could remedy that.
She was somewhat sparse with her gratitude, Hedron.  Perhaps you could remedy that.
The tenets of my faith preclude me from accepting this much wealth.  Your gratitude is enough.  Farewell.
The tenets of my order preclude the acceptance of this much wealth.  Your gratitude is enough.  Farewell.
Glad we could help.  Take care, Hedron.
She tested our patience, but this should serve to make up for it.  Farewell, Hedron.
The tenets of my faith preclude me from accepting this much wealth.  We were pleased to help you, and let us leave it at that.  Farewell.
The tenets of my order preclude the acceptance of this much wealth.  We were pleased to help you, and let us leave it at that.  Farewell.
Glad we could help.  Take care, Hedron.
She tested our patience, but this should serve to make up for it.  Farewell, Hedron.
The town was attacked by goblins.  We managed to drive them off and retake the docks.
There's been an attack on the docks.  If this keeps up, I suspect Targos is going to be the new home of the goblin horde in the near future.
We've managed to drive off the goblins, though it was a near thing.  Could you put us up for the night, Hedron?
The goblins have been taken care of... but if you caught word of the goblin attack, how come you haven't left yet?
The docks are safe, and the attacking goblins are dead.  Just returned to the ship to let you know - we'll speak again later.
There's still goblins about, and we need someplace safe to rest.  Can you watch over us while we catch our second wind?
We're still figuring out the extent of the goblin attack.  We'll return when we know more.  Farewell.
We don't know yet - we'll come back when we know more.
A good question.  You should probably set sail in any event - Targos is no longer safe.
I'm afraid she didn't make it, Hedron... she, uh, was killed by goblins in her home.
We already checked on her, Hedron.  Some goblins had broken into her house, but we took them out and rescued her.
We encountered an old woman being menaced by goblins - I don't know whether it was your mother or not.
Your mother?  Which house is hers?
We'll see what we can do - but we need someplace safe to rest.  Can you watch over us while we catch our second wind?
We'll go check on her, Hedron.  We'll return when she's safe.
I'm afraid she didn't make it, Hedron... she, uh, was killed by goblins in her home.
We already checked on her, Hedron.  Some goblins had broken into her house, but we took them out and rescued her.
We encountered an old woman being menaced by goblins - I don't know whether it was your mother or not.
Which house is hers again?
We'll see what we can do - but we need someplace safe to rest.  Can you watch over us while we catch our second wind?
We'll go check on her, Hedron.  We'll return when she's safe.
What happened to those houses on the shore?
Can you tell me anything about Targos?
Could you put us up for the night, Hedron?
How come you haven't left yet?
Nothing today, thanks.  Farewell.
Nothing today, thanks.  Farewell.
Why is that?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
If your mother's here why are you still aboard the ship?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Very well.  Farewell.
What happened to those houses on the shore?
Can you tell me anything about Targos?
Could you put us up for the night, Hedron?
How come you haven't left yet?
Nothing today, thanks.  Farewell.
Where can I find the Salty Dog Tavern?
The Salty Dog Tavern?  Sounds like a pirate watering hole.
So you're off, then?
Do you know where I can go to sign on with the Targos guard?
